alert.note: Alert for Uinta (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 09 at 6:35PM MST until January 09 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Rich County in northern Utah... East central Morgan County in northern Utah... Northeastern Summit County in northern Utah... Uinta County in southwestern Wyoming... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 635 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 13 miles south of Opal to 16 miles southwest of Evanston, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 184 and 196. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 52 and 54. Locations impacted include... Evanston, Lyman, Robertson, Lonetree, Mountain View, Millburne, Fort Bridger, Almy, Altamont, Carter, Ragen, Wahsatch, Castle Rock, Church Buttes, Piedmont, and Leroy. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
